an4.112:4.1: “Mendicants, a fine royal thoroughbred with four factors is worthy of a king, fit to serve a king, and considered a factor of kingship.
an4.112:4.4: A fine royal thoroughbred with these four factors is worthy of a king. …
an4.112:5.1: In the same way, a mendicant with four factors is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a teacher’s offering, worthy of veneration with folded palms, and is a supreme field of merit for the world.
an4.112:5.4: A mendicant with these four factors … is a supreme field of merit for the world.”
